author: racytech
content: Do we need to pass `blockchain_tests_engine` as well?

author: pdobacz
content:
As far as I can tell, the extra coverage from running `blockchain_tests_engine` is fairly orthogonal to EOF. I remember this has been discussed somewhere but can't remember the details - can someone from STEEL definitely say if and when we'll encourage or require running `blockchain_tests_engine` as well?

So for now we always were tracking passing of `state_tests`, `eof_tests` and `blockchain_tests` only

author: racytech
content: I just noticed that there is no `blockchain_tests_engine` row, probably something extra to make sure everything works right I guess

author: chfast
content:
Hi <@850939574217342978>,

Sorry for being late to the party, welcome.

I will try to check ASAP if these issues are up to date, but I think you are good to go.

For EOF tests overview we also have this tracker and you are free to pick anything not done there. Before adding new tests though, try to find if such tests don't exist already (this is usually the same work as figuring out where to physically put new tests). Finally, ping us that you started working on something.

GLHF
